metadata.title: CVE-2016-7444 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - low
metadata.description:
The gnutls_ocsp_resp_check_crt function in lib/x509/ocsp.c in GnuTLS before3.4.15 and 3.5.x before 3.5.4 does not verify the serial length of an OCSPresponse, which might allow remote attackers to bypass an intendedcertificate validation mechanism via vectors involving trailing bytes leftby gnutls_malloc.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-7444` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

gnutls-bin - 3.4.10-4ubuntu1.2
guile-gnutls - 3.4.10-4ubuntu1.2
libgnutls-openssl27 - 3.4.10-4ubuntu1.2
libgnutls30 - 3.4.10-4ubuntu1.2
libgnutlsxx28 - 3.4.10-4ubuntu1.2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: gnutls28 package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '3.4.10-4ubuntu1.2').
